seedit a foss peertopeer self hosted reddit alternative powered by ipfs ens and eth seedit is open source peertopeer reddit alternative built on ipfs ipns and libp2p no servers no apis no company behind it its fully selfhosted and cant be taken down or censored every community called a sub is cryptographically owned by its creator ens used to name a subuser each sub is independent and sovereign the creator decides which cryptocurrency is used for voting tipping or governance what moderation rules apply one sub might use eth or an erc20 for voting another might use btc lightning tips another might integrate polygon or arbitrum its completely open and interoperable

luxury life ends for bristol drug boss jailed with associates the luxury life of a drug gang boss has come to an end after police dismantled an organised crime group in bristol joe hatherall 32 formerly of emersons green south gloucestershire was arrested while on licence from prison for a previous sentence having returned to arranging the movement of heroin and cocaine throughout southwest england on friday he was sentenced at bristol crown court to 12 years and six months in prison three of hatheralls associates stefan dann ben bicknell and dean chick were also sentenced for their part in the gang avon and somerset police said around 10kg 22lbs of cocaine and 4kg 88lbs of heroin with a street value of more than 1m was seized by its officers during the investigation approximately 80000 in cash was taken from those working for the group and more than 30000 in cryptocurrency was confiscated from hatherall hatherall was released in january 2022 having served half of a nineyear sentence for conspiracy to supply cannabis within days of his release he was in contact with his network of associates the force said he was arrested in november 2022 and recalled to prison analysis of hatheralls encrypted phone showed he played a leading role in the organised crime group ocg and funded his lifestyle from the proceeds of crime dci adam smith of the south west regional organised crime unit said hatherall has shown a complete disregard for the harm caused by drugs and is driven by greed and a desire to live a life of luxury which included buying highvalue vehicles designer clothing cosmetic dentistry expensive watches and a jet ski

tools i actually stopped using addressable io is the biggest letdown tbh ive been doing crypto marketing for a while running ads building discords and testing every wallet insight tool i could find addressable io looked promising at first but after a few weeks i dipped heres why data looks nice but tells you nothing you get outputs not context they never really explain how the mapping works so youre just staring at charts without knowing what any of it means conversions were dead i tried targeting the lists they gave nothing looked great on paper but no actual users showed up i used different setups and had the same results i ran a few totally different campaigns inside addressable and the reports ended up looking almost identical doesnt exactly scream smart targeting support is mia you ask one detailed question and they hit you back with a copypaste faq it felt like talking to a wall pricings a joke youre basically dropping hundreds on what feels like a dressedup spreadsheet of wallet ids still using old logic the whole system feels stuck in earlyweb3 thinking as if surfacelevel wallet data alone can tell you real intent tldr looks sleek costs a ton and leaves you guessing save your budget for something that actually moves numbers

vertically challenged 6 tears teddy bears and terrible decisions a love story that shouldve stayed in the draft folder welcome back to vertically challenged the review series where we compress maximum melodrama into the shortest possible frameand todays episode proves some plots are best left in portrait mode for everyones sanity plot titleor what it should be the tragicomedy of su wanqing genre family melodrama romantic tragedy psychological warfare and unintentional comedy spoiler warning major spoilers ahead but honestly nothing can spoil a story that already selfdestructs when your billiondollar scam fails and its time to cosplay as employee of the monthsu wanqing invents mopcore chic for her exs sympathy olympics plot brief if you can call it that our hero zhou yunchuan a man so forgiving he makes gandhi look petty is baking a sad birthday cake for his daughter duoduo when his exwife su wanqing professional cheater and parttime delusional billionaire calls by accident turns out shes bankrupt her girlboss friends drunk on bad decisions and champagne dare her to milk her ex for pity money she shows up dressed as a janitor to test his loyalty because apparently emotional manipulation is foreplay now what follows is 50 episodes of he said she cheated the kid almost died and someone has heart disease until finally su realizes that the boytoy shen qinghe the poster child for red flags was only using her for money memes and moral decay theres fake bankruptcies medical drama emotional monologues and enough flashbacks to qualify as a timetravel show by the end su learns absolutely nothing zhou somehow forgives her again and shen is hauled off to prison probably for crimes against storytelling everyone cries reconciles and celebrates by eating the worlds most traumatic cake the moral money doesnt buy lovebut it sure can fund poor writing the review this saga plays like someone took every clich from 900 short dramas squeezed them into a blender and hit emotionally unstable pure the pacing is aggressiveno scene lasts more than a few seconds before a new revelation just barges in illness betrayal missing teddy bears fake cleaners you name it its here zhou yunchuan could set a guinness world record for tolerance hes like a doormat with health insurance su wanqings character arc goes from billionaire villainess to bankrupt janitor to billionaire againbasically the career graph of a cryptocurrency investor shen qinghe meanwhile is that kind of villain who doesnt just cross moral lineshe sets up toll booths and collects fees every serious scene unironically turns into meme material the tragic flashbacks are so overused that halfway through even the soundtrack sounds tired and just when you think its over shen reappears out of nowhere like expired leftovers no one threw out the dialogue feels written by chatgpts evil twin who just discovered revenge keywords the ending promises redemption cash payouts and champagne suggesting that true love can survive anythingincluding complete mental collapse honest character profiles zhou yunchuan human doormat has more patience than a monk and worse luck than a guy in a final destination movie su wanqing billionaire bimbo with a phd in bad choices could cheat during an apology and still play the victim shen qinghe walking red flag with wifi gaslights manipulates and monologues like hes auditioning for a ted talk on sociopathy duoduo sixyearold voice of reason trapped in a telenovela probably the only person viewers dont want to slap final score 3 out of 10 one star for duoduo one for the cakes emotional support and one for the audacity of whoever wrote this mess final conclusion the billionyuan betrayal is less of a drama and more of a psychological experiment to see how long you can scream at your screen before throwing your phone its like watching a morality play written by chatgpt on a sugar high performed by emotionally unstable sims everyone cries nobody grows and the cake probably tastes like regret watch it if you love chaos hate logic and want to feel better about your own life choices link to share if you have ever hated someone enough to ruin their evening send them this plot and tell them its a powerful love story the bankruptcy gamedramachina

at least 25 youth from nagaland were among 117 individuals arrested by the police in maharashtra for allegedly running an international fake call centre that duped american citizens at least 25 youth from nagaland were among 117 individuals arrested by the police in maharashtra for allegedly running an international fake call centre that duped american citizens as per reports the arrests were made on 29 october following a police raid at a call centre in aurangabad under midc cidco police station the suspects were produced in court and their bail hearing is scheduled for 10 november according to police the scam involved stealing data of us citizens and posing as tax officials to extort money victims were allegedly told they had pending tax dues and were instructed to buy digital gift cards to settle the amount the card numbers were then used to siphon funds which were later converted into cryptocurrency source fo

how masterminds built a 26 billion crime network that nobody can stop 17yearold jordan demay was having the conversation of his life it was march 2022 a beautiful girl had started messaging him on instagram she was interested flirty she wanted to see him and jordan like any teenage boy who suddenly finds himself the centre of attention from someone attractive was thrilled they talked for hours she sent photos he sent photos back it was normal teenage stuff except the girl wasnt real the photos were stolen from someones social media and the person on the other end of those messages was a 24yearold man named samuel ogoshi sitting in nigeria running what he and his brother called a business within hours of sending those photos jordan received a message that changed everything pay me 1000 or i send these pictures to everyone you know your family your school everyone jordan panicked he didnt have 1000 he tried to explain he begged he told them he was thinking about killing himself and samuel ogoshi the man whod spent hours pretending to be a teenage girl whod manipulated jordan into trust who was now extorting him typed back good do it ill wait six hours later jordan demay shot himself in the head samuel and his brother samson had been running this scam on over 100 victims eleven of them were minors jordan was the one who couldnt take it anymore the ogoshi brothers were eventually caught extradited from nigeria and sentenced to 175 years in us federal prison we all though justice served right except heres what nobody wants to talk about the ogoshi brothers werent masterminds they were foot soldiers entrylevel operators in a massive sophisticated criminal network that spans 50 countries generates an estimated 26 billion per year and has been operating with increasing sophistication for over two decades and the people who designed this system who created the scripts the ogoshi brothers used who trained them who launder the billions who coordinate operations across continents are completely invisible this is the story of the most successful unsolved crime of the 21st century and its still happening right now lets go back to where this really started before we can understand how this criminal empire works we need to understand something critical this is not a new scam that suddenly appeared this is an evolution a deliberate strategic evolution from something you probably remember the nigerian prince emails remember those dear sirmadam i am prince whoever from nigeria and i have 25 million trapped in a bank account if you help me transfer it i will give you 10 everyone laughed at those emails they became a joke who would fall for that people asked and the writing was terrible the stories were absurd and the whole thing seemed obviously fake but heres what most people missed those emails worked not on everyone not even on most people but on enough people the fbi estimated that nigerian 419 scams named after the nigerian criminal code section generated hundreds of millions of dollars annually throughout the 1990s and early 2000s the scammers running those operations learned something valuable western people with money could be manipulated into sending cash if you pushed the right psychological buttons greed worked but greed had limits people got suspicious they told friends they reported to authorities so around the mid2000s as online dating platforms exploded and social media made it easy to create fake identities someone and we still dont know who had a brilliant terrible idea what if instead of targeting peoples greed we targeted their loneliness what if instead of promising them money we promised them love what if we spent weeks or months building emotional connections before asking for anything what if we made them fall in love with us first so that when we finally asked for money theyd want to help that innovation targeting emotional vulnerability instead of financial greed created the romance scam industry and it changed everything the architecture of emotional destruction let me show you how sophisticated this has become there are warehouses in nigeria they call them hustle kingdoms or yahoo schools where this is taught as a profession not like a criminal operation like a trade school like youd learn carpentry or plumbing these facilities have computer labs with 2050 stations highspeed internet training materials and standardized scripts instructors called ogas who teach manipulation techniques room and board for trainees young men usually 1825 years old from regions with 40 youth unemployment enroll in these schools they pay no tuition fee upfront instead they agree to give 2040 of everything they steal to the oga until theyve paid back their training costs after that they pay 1030 forever the oga provides everything scripts for different victim types widows divorcees single mothers elderly men stolen photos from real peoples social media accounts fake identity templates instructions on cryptocurrency and money laundering psychological manipulation techniques software tools for managing multiple victims simultaneously and there is one thing that should terrify you these scripts are incredibly sophisticated im talking about documents that are thousands of words long containing 3060 sequential exchanges designed to systematically break down a victims skepticism and build emotional dependency these are not improvised these are engineered psychological weapons a typical script includes how to introduce yourself often as military personnel oil rig workers doctors working for ngos professions that explain long absences specific compliments designed to make victims feel valued religious language to establish moral authority god brought us together timed escalation of intimacy when to say i love you when to discuss future plans predetermined responses to common objections why cant we video chat my camera is broken and im deployed overseas escalation protocols for when victims get suspicious exact wording for financial requests and the craziest part is these scripts are publicly available theyre on tiktok youtube telegram scribd people sell premium versions there are entire communities of scammers sharing tips reviewing each others approaches trading stolen photos like baseball cards the threetier invisible pyramid you know what is truly disturbing this is not just random criminals doing random crimes this is an organized hierarchical system with three distinct tiers tier 1 the streetlevel scammers the visible layer these are the guys actually messaging victims young men usually 1830 years old sitting in internet cafes or hustle kingdoms managing 510 fake identities simultaneously theyre the ones having the conversations building the relationships asking for money when they get caught and thousands do get caught every year it makes news nigerian scammer arrested romance fraud ring busted governments celebrate the fbi issues press releases but arresting these guys accomplishes nothing because for every one arrested two more are being trained these are replaceable parts in a machine removing them doesnt damage the machine tier 2 the middle management the operational layer these are the hustle kingdom proprietors guys whove been successfully scamming for 510 years and have accumulated enough wealth to transition from doing the work themselves to teaching others to do it they recruit they train they take their cut a single oga managing 2050 active scammers can make 100000500000 per month over a career were talking 550 million in earnings very very few of these people ever get arrested they operate in communities where this is semiaccepted as legitimate business local police are often paid off theyre insulated from direct contact with victims so evidence linking them to specific crimes is hard to establish tier 3 the architects the invisible layer and then theres the top tier the people we know almost nothing about these are the people who 1 design the psychological manipulation scripts 2 coordinate money laundering networks across multiple countries 3 establish relationships with cryptocurrency exchanges and banking systems 4 make strategic decisions about which victim demographics to target 5 develop new technologies like the deepfake video calls that started appearing in 2022 6 integrate operations with organized crime syndicates we dont know their names we dont know how many there are we dont know where they operate from we know they exist because the system is too sophisticated too coordinated too resilient to be the product of independent operators but theyve designed the system so that they have zero direct contact with victims no evidence trail no witnesses who can identify them theyre insulated by layers of operational separation when police arrest a streetlevel scammer they cant identify the oga who trained them when they arrest an oga they cant identify the architects because hes never met them communication happens through encrypted channels money moves through cryptocurrency identities are compartmentalized its brilliant its terrifying and it works we dont know the masterminds but can we guess i dont think they are sitting somewhere in africa and designing and running a sophisticated game like this whats your guess the numbers that should keep you awake lets talk about scale because i dont think people understand how massive this is romance scams alone cost us victims 1 13 billion in 2022 2 114 billion in 2023 3 median individual loss 4400 4 but many victims lose 50000500000 thats just reported losses in just one country most victims never report because of shame so real losses are probably 23x higher but romance scams are just one product line the same infrastructure and personnel also run business email compromise bec scams cryptocurrency investment fraud sextortion the thing that killed jordan demay gift card scams money laundering operations when you add it all up nigerianbased cybercriminals extract an estimated 26 billion annually worldwide to put that in perspective thats more than the gdp of 50 countries thats more than nikes annual revenue thats a midsized nations economy built entirely on fraud and its growing every year losses increase every year more sophisticated techniques emerge every year more victim demographics get targeted when romance scams evolved into murder around 20202021 something changed the architects of this system realized theyd been leaving money on the table romance scams required weeks or months of building relationships before asking for money thats labourintensive timeconsuming what if there was a faster way enter sextortion the model is brutally simple create fake profile of attractive young woman target teenage boys on instagram snapchat tiktok quickly escalate to sexual conversation convince victim to send explicit photosvideo immediately demand payment or threaten to send content to victims family friends school the timeline collapses from months to hours a scammer can run 1020 simultaneous sextortion attempts in a single day hit rate is lower but volume makes up for it and here is something even darker the perpetrators discovered that teenage boys are extraordinarily vulnerable to this attack because they have no experience recognizing manipulation theyre terrified of social humiliation they dont have money so they panic and borrow from parents or consider suicide theyre ashamed to tell anyone so they suffer alone the numbers are staggering 1 1000 increase in sextortion cases in 18 months 20222023 2 26718 financial sextortion reports in 2023 alone 3 at least 30 documented suicides linked to sextortion since 2021 jordan demay wasnt alone there are many 1 ryan last 17 california 2 royce parkinson 17 australia 3 numerous others whose families are still processing the trauma and heres what makes this especially evil when jordan told the ogoshi brothers he was suicidal they encouraged him do it fast ill wait because they knew that if he killed himself thered be no witness no testimony just a dead teenager and grieving parents who wouldnt understand what happened the money trail that goes nowhere so where does 26 billion go thats the question that haunts investigators because tracking the money should in theory be possible money has to move through financial systems even cryptocurrency leaves traces follow the money find the criminals its simple right except the system is designed to make that impossible heres how it works step 1 victim sends money usually through wire transfers harder to trace cryptocurrency even harder gift cards nearly impossible theyre like cash once used payment apps zelle venmo cash app step 2 money mules scammers recruit money mules often unwitting accomplices who are told theyre helping with business transactions mules receive funds take a small cut and forward the rest this creates separation between scammer and victim step 3 cryptocurrency conversion funds converted to bitcoin ethereum or more obscure cryptocurrencies through exchanges with varying verification requirements one transaction becomes 510 transactions across multiple wallets step 4 international layering crypto moves through wallets in singapore switzerland cayman islands uae bouncing between exchanges with different jurisdictional authorities step 5 cashout finally converted back to local currency through offshore exchanges and withdrawn as cash or transferred to final accounts the sophistication lies in decentralization theres no single chokepoint disrupt one exchange and they route through others arrest one money mule and ten more are recruited seize one wallet and funds are already distributed across 50 others and heres the terrifying part when governments announce big seizures we recovered 3 million in assets it sounds impressive until you realize thats 001 of annual proceeds its a rounding error black axe when crime becomes corporate now let me introduce you to the most sophisticated player in this ecosystem black axe black axe officially the neo black movement of africa started as a college fraternity in nigeria in 1977 but over decades it evolved into something far darker a transnational organized crime syndicate operating in 50 countries with an estimated 30000 members black axe is what happens when romance scam infrastructure meets organized crime sophistication 1 hierarchical structure with defined ranks and roles 2 violent enforcement capability members who cooperate with police or steal from the organization are murdered 3 integrated financial operations with professional money laundering 4 political connections and corruption networks 5 international coordination in apriljuly 2024 interpol ran operation jackal iii specifically targeting black axe and affiliated groups 1 300 arrests across 21 countries 2 3 million in seized assets 3 720 frozen bank accounts does this sound successful except interpols own assessment concluded that black axe remains one of the most prominent west african transnational organized crime syndicates the operation barely dented their capabilities and heres a number that should terrify you canadian authorities identified a single black axelinked money laundering operation that had processed over 5 billion in illicit proceeds one operation five billion dollars and it was only discovered because someone got sloppy how many other 5 billion operations are running that havent been discovered the convictions that dont matter lets talk about the arrests and convictions because this is where the systems genius really shows every year headlines announce 100 scammers arrested romance fraud ring dismantled major cybercrime operation shut down and its true thousands of arrests happen annually convictions follow people go to prison but heres what nobody mentions 96 of convictions are streetlevel perpetrators the guys actually talking to victims the replaceable foot soldiers when researchers analysed 100 convicted cases in nigeria 96 were primary scammers lowest tier 4 were middletier operators 0 were highlevel organizers or architects and of those arrests what happens a 22yearold gets sentenced to 25 years in prison he serves his time when he gets out he goes right back to scamming now with more experience and better connections from meeting other scammers in prison meanwhile while that one guy serves his sentence the hustle kingdom that trained him has recruited and trained 50 more the net effect of law enforcement is negative its like trying to stop a forest fire by arresting individual trees the fbis stunning admission in 2024 an fbi official made a statement that should have been frontpage news but got buried in routine crime coverage weve only successfully indicted three highlevel sextortion masterminds despite the 1000 increase in cases think about that three out of thousands of operations out of tens of thousands of perpetrators out of a 26 billion industry theyve successfully prosecuted three people at the organizational level the ogoshi brothers are two of those three and theyre not even that high up in the hierarchy they were just two guys running a midlevel operation what about the actual architects still invisible the technology now heres where this story takes a turn into genuine science fiction nightmare territory in 2022 scammers started using something new realtime deepfake video calls previously the reason scammers avoided video calls was obvious they couldnt look like the photos theyd been sending theyd make excuses my camera is broken the connection where i am is too slow for video military regulations prohibit video calls but now they can do video calls where their face is completely convincingly fake heres how it works 1 two phones 2 faceswapping app freely available online 3 phone 1 shows the fake face on the call 4 phone 2 captures scammers real face and movements 5 software swaps the faces in realtime the victim sees a beautiful woman or handsome man talking to them expressions matching the voice perfectly looking exactly like the photos except its completely fabricated the person doesnt exist and the technology is getting better exponentially better every month the faceswapping gets more convincing the lag decreases the glitches get fixed within 23 years this technology will be so good that even experts wont be able to reliably detect it youll be able to have hourlong video conversations with someone who looks sounds and moves like a real person except theyre completely fabricated how do you combat that how do you tell someone the person youve been video calling for six months is not real when they can literally see them the jurisdictional nightmare lets talk about why nobody can stop this the fundamental problem is that romance scams are international by design the perpetrator is in nigeria the victim is in california the money goes through accounts in singapore and switzerland before being converted to cryptocurrency and laundered through exchanges in the cayman islands which country has jurisdiction who prosecutes and under what laws to prosecute in the us you need to extradite from nigeria except nigeria and the us have an extradition treaty with massive loopholes nigeria can refuse extradition if 1 the crime is not considered serious enough they have their own problems 2 the evidence doesnt meet their standards 3 the suspect is a nigerian citizen they rarely extradite their own 4 officials are bribed to delaydeny the request and even if you get extradition approved you need cooperation from every country where money passed through each jurisdiction has different evidence standards legal procedures cooperation agreements the corruption enabler but theres another layer to this that makes it even harder corruption in nigeria ghana and other west african countries where these operations flourish cybercrime is often a semiaccepted part of the economy not legally accepted but socially accepted in regions with 40 youth unemployment where formal education is inaccessible and legitimate jobs pay 50month scamming represents one of the few paths to wealth young men who successfully scam can build houses for their families pay for siblings education become respected community members the unanswered questions 1 who designed the original romance scam scripts someone somewhere around 20052008 figured out that emotional manipulation was more powerful than greedbased scams someone wrote the first sophisticated romance scam script someone tested it refined it turned it into a teachable methodology who was that person are they still active did they realize they were creating a blueprint that would destroy thousands of lives and generate billions in losses or was it just a clever innovation they didnt think would scale this large we dont know nobody knows but if you notice the sophistication in the entire design can you guess 2 how much money is actually missing governments have recovered maybe 12 billion total across all years all countries all efforts but annual losses are estimated at 26 billion over 20 years were talking about 300500 billion stolen where is it thats not hidden in a swiss bank account money thats entire nations gdp money thats build cities buy governments fund armies money 3 why arent tech companies doing more facebook instagram snapchat tiktok these platforms are where the scams happen they have ai that can detect copyrighted music in videos uploaded from bedrooms they can identify faces analyze speech patterns track behavior across billions of users but romance scammers and sextortion operations run openly on their platforms using stolen photos that appear in hundreds of fake accounts following predictable patterns that should be trivially easy to detect 4 whats the ultimate endgame this system has been operating and growing for 20 years annual proceeds increase technology improves victim demographics expand the operation becomes more sophisticated whats the longterm trajectory 5 how many people have died we know of at least 30 suicides linked to sextortion we know many elderly victims who lost their life savings suffered health crises from stress we know some victims became suicidal but how many people have actually died directly or indirectly as a result of romance scams suicide heart attacks strokes from financial devastation health problems from stress nobody tracks this nobody counts but given the millions of victims over 20 years the number is probably in the thousands maybe tens of thousands 6 why cant we stop this this is the question that summarizes everything we know how the system works we know approximately where it operates from we know the infrastructure required we know the financial pathways we know the technology used but after 20 years and thousands of arrests the system is bigger than ever is it fundamentally impossible to stop have we reached a point where transnational cybercrime is simply too complex too distributed too adaptive for traditional law enforcement to combat i am just raising these basic question without giving any probable theory like a conspiracy theorist the invisible empire nobodys fighting let me bring this home with a final disturbing thought right now at this exact moment there are probably 1000050000 people sitting at computers in nigeria ghana south africa and other countries actively scamming victims running romance scams on lonely widows extorting teenage boys manipulating people into crypto investment fraud building relationships that will destroy lives and bank accounts and somewhere in offices in homes in places well never see there are the architects the people who designed this system who coordinate it who profit most from it who have elevated fraud to an industrial scale theyve built a 26 billion empire that spans 50 countries employs tens of thousands destroys millions of lives and operates with effective immunity from prosecution theyve weaponized human loneliness and sexual desire as tools of financial extraction theyve created training systems that turn desperate young men into professional manipulators theyve integrated organized crime cryptocurrency ai and deepfake technology into a nightmare fusion of exploitation and we cant stop them we cant even find them they built an empire out of loneliness and shame and theyre winning the question is not whether this system can be stopped its whether anyone is actually trying to stop the right people because right now theyre ghosts and ghosts dont fear arrest warrants

gree amazing comeback after years of legal and regulatory uncertainty greenidge generation holdings nasdaq gree is back in the spotlight news of a historic agreement with the state of new york to renew its air permit has completely reshaped investor perception of this small but remarkably interesting energytechnology company greenidge operates a modern power generation and data center facility in dresden new york which simultaneously produces electricity and uses it for its own cryptocurrency mining operations unlike most competitors greenidge does not rely on external grid power it generates its own energy during periods of high demand the company can redirect power from mining to the public grid within minutes helping stabilize supply and lower local electricity costs the agreement with state regulator nysdec grants greenidge a new fiveyear operating window and ends years of litigation that had weighed on the companys stock it also requires a 44 reduction in greenhouse gas emissions by 2030 exceeding the goals of new yorks own climate leadership and community protection ac sending a strong message about greenidges commitment to sustainability on the market gree remains a lowcap stock with a valuation around 23 million but its position could change rapidly if the renewed facility proves to be a steady source of revenue with investor interest returning to the energy sector and intermittent surges in cryptocurrency prices greenidge could potentially benefit from both sides energy production and digital infrastructure analysts following smallcap and penny stocks suggest that gree might become one of 2026s potential gainers particularly if it confirms operational efficiency and expands the share of energy supplied to the grid since acquiring the dresden facility in 2016 greenidge has invested over 100 million in modernization transforming a former coal plant into a natural gas power station the company now contributes nearly 10 of all tax revenue in yates county and its recent agreement with new york state is widely seen as a turning point from regulatory struggle to a credible growth story

a cryptocurrency colloquially crypto is a digital currency designed to work through a computer network that is not reliant on any central authority such as a government or bank to uphold or maintain it however a type of cryptocurrency called a stablecoin may rely upon government action or legislation to require that a stable value be upheld and maintained individual coin ownership records are stored in a digital ledger or blockchain which is a computerized database that uses a consensus mechanism to secure transaction records control the creation of additional coins and verify the transfer of coin ownership the two most common consensus mechanisms are proof of work and proof of stake despite the name which has come to describe many of the fungible blockchain tokens that have been created cryptocurrencies are not considered to be currencies in the traditional sense and varying legal treatments have been applied to them in various jurisdictions including classification as commodities securities and currencies cryptocurrencies are generally viewed as a distinct asset class in practice the first cryptocurrency was bitcoin which was first released as opensource software in 2009 as of june 2023 there were more than 25000 other cryptocurrencies in the marketplace of which more than 40 had a market capitalization exceeding 1 billion as of april 2025 the cryptocurrency market capitalization was already estimated at 276 trillion history in 1983 american cryptographer david chaum conceived of a type of cryptographic electronic money called ecash later in 1995 he implemented it through digicash an early form of cryptographic electronic payments digicash required user software in order to withdraw notes from a bank and designate specific encrypted keys before they could be sent to a recipient this allowed the digital currency to be untraceable by a third party in 1996 the national security agency published a paper entitled how to make a mint the cryptography of anonymous electronic cash describing a cryptocurrency system the paper was first published in an mit mailing list october 1996 and later april 1997 in the american law review in 1998 wei dai described bmoney an anonymous distributed electronic cash system shortly thereafter nick szabo described bit gold like bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies that would follow it bit gold not to be confused with the later goldbased exchange bitgold was described as an electronic currency system that required users to complete a proof of work function with solutions being cryptographically put together and published in january 2009 bitcoin was created by pseudonymous developer satoshi nakamoto it used sha256 a cryptographic hash function in its proofofwork scheme in april 2011 namecoin was records called blocks which are linked and secured using cryptography each block typically contains a hash pointer as a link to a previous block a timestamp and transaction data by design blockchains are inherently resistant to modification of the data a blockchain is an open distributed ledger that can record transactions between two parties efficiently and in a verifiable and permanent way for use as a distributed ledger a blockchain is typically managed by a peertopeer network collectively adhering to a protocol for validating new blocks once recorded the data in any given block cannot be altered retroactively without the alteration of all subsequent blocks which requires collusion of the network majority blockchains are secure by design and are an example of a distributed computing system with high byzantine fault tolerance decentralized consensus has therefore been achieved with a blockchain nodes a node is a computer that connects to a cryptocurrency network the node supports the cryptocurrencys network through either relaying transactions validation or hosting a copy of the blockchain in terms of relaying transactions each network computer node has a copy of the blockchain of the cryptocurrency it supports when a transaction is made the node creating the transaction broadcasts details of the transaction using encryption to other nodes throughout the node transactions added to the blockchain ledger without the need for a trusted third party the first timestamping scheme invented was the proofofwork scheme the most widely used proofofwork schemes are based on sha256 and scrypt some other hashing algorithms that are used for proofofwork include cryptonote blake sha3 and x11 another method is called the proofofstake scheme proofofstake is a method of securing a cryptocurrency network and achieving distributed consensus through requesting users to show ownership of a certain amount of currency it is different from proofofwork systems that run difficult hashing algorithms to validate electronic transactions the scheme is largely dependent on the coin and there is currently no standard form of it some cryptocurrencies use a combined
